item.title: Git
item.description: Git and Github Git is a version control system use to track changes to code, and when combined with Github it is an extremely powerful way to collaborate. (1) Start by creating a Github Account on github.com. (2) Install Github desktop if using OSX or Windows. Click here for download instructions for Github Desktop. (If you are a Linux user you probably already have git installed.) (3) Once you are done installing Github desktop, open the program.

item.title: Online Classes
item.description: Data Camp As part of this class you get a free subscription to Data Camp. I can’t post it here but will provide via email. Fast-AI Deep learning class. Siraj Rival Extremely entertaining YouTube star covers a wide variety of things in machine learning.

item.title: Office/Lab Hours
item.description: Office/Lab Hours: Thursday 10:00 - 12:00 and by appointment Office/Lab Location: I’ll hold office hours in the SA lounge for the majority of the time. If it is occupied with a seminar I’ll be in Pittsburgh 4108 (Located in the Severino Center). This class doesn’t have an official lab section because of graduate student scheduling. As a result, we will use office hours as a secondary “Lab” time for people who are just getting started with technology.

item.title: Schedule
item.description: Date Readings/Content/Assignments 1 9-11 The Rise of Analytics This class is to discuss the broader issues of data analytics, the approach of the class, and the technologies to be utilized. We will also show you how to work in Jupyter Notebooks and with Git/Github. [[Presentation]() Homework 1 Released ] 2 9-18 Intro to Python Click Here [Homework 2 Released] 3 9-25 Intro to Python (continued) Click Here [Homework 3 Released] 4 10-2 Intro to R Click Here [Homework 4 Released] 10-9 Columbus Day - No Class 5 10-10 (Tuesday) Intro to R (continued) Click Here [Homework 5 Released] 6 10-16 Intro to Visualization Click Here 7 10-23 Data Munging Click Here 8 10-30 Midterm Click Here 9 11-6 Introduction to Modeling I Click Here 10 11-13 Introduction to Modeling II Click Here 11 11-20 **Text Mining and Unstructured Data ** Click Here 12 11-27 Introduction to Big Data Click Here 13 12-4 Introduction to Deep Learning Click Here 14 12-11 **Presentations ** 15 TBD** Final Exam Click Here Class 1 Course Overview & Introduction to the Data Science Lifecycle Class Objective: This class is to discuss the broader issues of data analytics, the approach of the class, and the technologies to be utilized.

item.title: Grading
item.description: Component Weight Homeworks and Labs and Quizzes 30% Participation 5% 2 Kaggle Projects 25% Midterm (7th Class) 15% Final Exam 25%

item.title: Python
item.description: Introduction to Machine Learning with Python by Andreas C. MÃ¼ller; Sarah Guido (Available through library) Think Stats Probability and Statistics for Programmers in Python (free download) Conda Python + Numpy Tutorial Python Docs Tutorial Python: Conda Python + Numpy Tutorial Python Docs Tutorial Plotting: matplotlib.pyplot tutorial: This short tutorial provides an overview of the basic plotting utilities we will be using.

item.title: Assignments
item.description: Labs Labs will be designed to be completed during class. However, they will be due the Friday after class. Homework Assignments from one class will be due the following Wednesday by 11:59 PM. This allows for an time to ask about an assignment. These are instructions for submitting labs and assignments lab. We will be using Github Classroom to distribute and collect all assignments. This is new for this semester so expect some bumps.

item.title: Books
item.description: O’Reilly Media titles can be accessed through the RPI library subscription. If there is a specific title you would like access to that isn’t listed, the library can adjust the list. Data Science & Business Data Science for Business Git Pro Git R Introduction to Statistical Learning (Free online PDF) R for Data Science (available online) Introduction to Machine Learning with Python by Andreas C.
